info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 8:54AM CDT until September 24 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Arkansas, including the following county, southern Nevada.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 851 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen so far this morning. Should the heavy rain persist across Southern Nevada County, a Flash Flood Warning will be needed. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches, with isolated higher amounts, are expected over the area through late morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rosston, Willisville, Bodcaw, Bluff City, Cale, Waterloo, Mount Moriah, Young, Morris and Falcon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING
